<title level="1" right="Hazard 6" pfs="">[Soul Draining Cage](/Hazards.aspx?ID=125)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
<trait label="Negative" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=118" />
<trait label="Trap" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=158" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #176: Lost Mammoth Valley](/Sources.aspx?ID=113) pg. 38</row>

**Complexity** Simple

</column>

Necromantic runes inscribed on the cage bars and lock drain the vitality of living creatures who interact with the cage.

---

**Stealth**
DC 25 (expert) or [_detect magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=66)

**Disable**
[Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) DC 25 (expert) to drain the runes power harmlessly or [_dispel magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=78) (3rd level; [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) DC 22) to counteract the rune

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

**Soul Drain** <actions string="Reaction" /> ([arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [negative](/Traits.aspx?ID=118)) **Trigger** A creature touches the cage bars, door, or lock directly or with a tool; **Effect** The trap deals 4d8+18 negative damage to the triggering creature, creatures inside the cage, and all creatures adjacent to the cage (DC 27 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save). On a failed save, a creature is also [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10) 1.
